content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" increases the deduction for interest on education loans by adjusting the $100,000 and $200,000 amounts based on the cost-of-living adjustment. These changes apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Repeal of termination of Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective date applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. SEC. 4. EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions to $5,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is after December 31, 2007. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. In amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, definitions for qualified higher education expenses and eligible educational institutions are clarified. Tuition reduction programs are also addressed by removing a specific phrase. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to clarify definitions for qualified higher education expenses and eligible educational institutions. The amendments also address tuition reduction programs by removing a specific phrase and substituting 'qualified higher education expenses' for 'tuition' in certain instances. These changes are effective for expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education provided in academic periods starting after that date. SEC. 6. Expansion of educational expenses allowed for Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants will not reduce the Hope Scholarship Credit. The amendments to the tax code expand qualified tuition expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment. Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants will not reduce the credit. Effective December 31, 2007, expenses paid after this date are eligible for the amended rules. The amendments made by this section apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007 for education furnished in academic periods beginning after that date. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 exempts certain education provisions from the sunset provisions of the Act.
